meanings.definition: To cry softly or querulously; whine
meanings.sent1: The puppy puled when it missed its owner.
meanings.sent2: The baby puled for attention from its parents.
meanings.sent3: The kitten puled in protest when given a bath.
meanings.sent4: The wind puled through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The child puled with sadness after losing their favorite toy.

meanings.definition: To utter a weak, querulous sound
meanings.sent1: The old man puled as he struggled to stand up.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird puled in pain.
meanings.sent3: The rusty door puled open slowly.
meanings.sent4: The violin string puled as it was tuned.
meanings.sent5: The tired engine puled as the car climbed the steep hill.
